etymologies: via Latin from Greek Akhilleios, denoting a plant supposed to have been used medicinally by Achilles

definitions: a plant of the daisy family, which typically has heads of small white or yellow flowers and fernlike leaves.

notes.text: Genus Achillea, family Compositae: numerous species, including the common yarrow

shortDefinitions: Eurasian and North African plant of genus that includes yarrow
